title: Calories in Boiled Sweet Corn
meta_description: Discover calories in sweet corn boiled per 100 g, including carbs, protein, fiber, and full nutrition breakdown with tweaks and FAQs.
assumptions: Fresh yellow sweet corn kernels, boiled without salt or added fat; drained.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by corn variety, freshness, cooking time, and added seasonings. Check labels for canned or frozen versions.

quick_answer.text: 100 g of boiled sweet corn provides ~96 kcal and ~3.4 g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Canned sweet corn (drained, with added salt)
Boiled with 1/2 tsp salt per 100 g

faqs.q: How many calories in 100 g boiled sweet corn?
faqs.a: Approximately 96 kcal per 100 g of boiled sweet corn kernels.

faqs.q: What are the carbs in boiled sweet corn?
faqs.a: About 21 g carbs, including 2.7 g fiber and 4.5 g sugars per 100 g.

faqs.q: Is boiled sweet corn high in protein?
faqs.a: It provides 3.4 g protein per 100 g, a modest amount for a vegetable.

faqs.q: Does boiling affect calories in sweet corn?
faqs.a: Boiling has minimal impact; calories remain similar to raw, around 96 kcal per 100 g.

faqs.q: How does canned compare to fresh boiled sweet corn?
faqs.a: Canned may add 5â€“10 kcal per 100 g due to processing, plus higher sodium.
